title: X Factor: Celebrity star Ricki Lake vows to 'be better' next week
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Ricki Lake has promised X Factor: Celebrity fans that she’ll put on a better performance during next week’s live shows.

The former chat show host was put through to the next stage of the ITV competition by judge Nicole Scherzinger last night, despite stumbling over the lyrics to her rendition of James Bay’s Us during her audition.

Addressing her slip up on Sunday Brunch with Simon Rimmer and Tim Lovejoy, Ricki vowed that she will go the extra mile when she returns to perform again.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I wouldn’t say I was nervous,’ she began. ‘It is nervewracking. He had 50 of his music buddies in the audience, many of whom I knew.

‘It was a weird thing to be a contestant but I wouldn’t say I was nervous, my heart wasn’t racing. I was actually really excited.’

Ricki continued: ‘But I was a little disappointed that I messed up. I promise, the people watching, I will be better next week.’

Ricki Lake took to the stage on last night’s X Factor: Celebrity (Picture: Rex Features)

Talking about why she signed up for X Factor: Celebrity, Ricki added: ‘I embrace all opportunity and I love being able to reinvent myself.

‘This opportunity came along and I was like, “Yeah, why not?”‘

Last night’s show saw The Chase’s Jenny Ryan sent home despite smashing her audition in controversial scenes with angry viewers calling the result a ‘fix’.

Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Nicole also decided to eliminate duo Brendan Cole & Jeremy Edwards and Hayley Hasselhoff from the series.

Meanwhile, Vinnie Jones was also announced to be appearing at the live shows, after being forced to pull out of auditions due to the death of his wife Tanya.

The remaining acts are all competing for a record contract on Simon’s label, with hopes of actually building a music career from the show.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Sunday Brunch airs Sundays at 9.30am on Channel 4 with X Factor returning Saturday at 8.35pm on ITV.

description: X Factor: Celebrity star Ricki Lake vows to 'be better' next week after messing up her audition.
